column5: Had the afternoon free today and decided to hit the ice solo. Slow start, pretty much just drilled holes and went into search mode. I never did get on to anything much the first hour and but by 2:00 pm I had found some fish that were very finicky. I was fishing agressive with jigging raps and spoons with not much luck so I decided to slow it down and fish some forage minnows with live minnows. Needles to say I found out very quickly this was a much better approach. The action wasnt fast and furious, I had to really use my vex and coax the fish into biting. Perch, Crappie, Largemouth and Northern Pike were caught today....  Best panfish for the day     Beautiful pike caught on a 32 inch ultra light with 4# line. It took me a solid 20 minutes to land this fish...measured in at a bit over 38 inches That is all my blood by the way....she got me but well worth it...    Going back       It was a great way to end 2009... Good luck to everyone in the new year  TDunn
Awesome report...congrats on that Pike.   Cheers  Craig
Hey nice work. Fishing solo can be very rewarding at times. Good thing the camera knew how to take a few shots on its own...lol...good trip out. I find solo is good for the mind reset.
Great report Bud.  If that's all your blood - ya may be needing a transfusion. Congrats on the monster pike.
That pike is a beauty - did she make a plop as she came thru that hole?  Thanks for your report.
Great job out there!  Best of luck in 2010

Yep self timer is priceless....and yes I too find solo fishing a great mind reset   Nope no plop when she came up   Thanks Mike, you too!       Thanks and ya It was a nice gash. It bleed for quite awhile after I released the fish...but today it doesnt look like much of a cut...
Nice report...its good to see fish on here again. Pine island area?
yeah I was in that area   TDunn
Nice fishes Tdunn.  Great way to start the season, that's for sure.
You got to love ending the season on a high note Beauty multi species report TDunn Congrats on the nice gator  Thanks for sharing Leechman
I never knew we had crappie around here. Ice looks good anyway...and making more tonight...-22c right now
Thats my first from the Soo area but I seen my buddy catch one in the same spot a few years back. Other than that ive heard a few stories of them being caught in Lake George.    TDunn
